alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued February 24 at 3:08AM PST until February 25 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 33 expected. * WHERE...Santa Clara Valley, including San Jose. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will be hazardous to unsheltered or marginally sheltered populations, kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest temperatures will be across the southern Santa Clara Valley and areas surrounding the urban core of the City of San Jose.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose
